section_data.title: Machine Learning Research
details: Analyzed feature space with tools such as SVD, PCA and Spectral Clustering. Analyzed quality of the data by calculating variance of the eye-gaze plots clustered by locations weighted by pupil diameter variance. Integrated saccade orientation related features from other research papers.
Created a presentation with ROC curves, Mesh Grids, Cross-Validation charts and Histograms – beginning the process to publish results.

Researched and subsequently extracted features from the 2012 Zola Study dataset with a fixation-saccade algorithm from 100+ GB .eyd binary files. Created infrastructure to store data into .json files - required optimized processing since .eyd files could not be stored in memory.

Used bootstrapped learning to train Naïve Bayes, SVM and Logistic Regression (used AdaBoost) models, integrated extracted features into existing consumer data and built Django API endpoints to obtain relevant data and designed models to add comments, metadata and scores.

section_data.title: Software Engineer Internship
details: Full stack web development with Google App Engine using a Flask framework – extensive coding with Python, JavaScript, and Jinja2

Integrated API’s from 10 bit exchanges (used OAuth2 authentication) and designed 3 RESTful API endpoints for various currency functionalities including querying specific data and creating company profiles – worked directly with reps from each company w/ an API

section_data.header: UC Berkeley UGBA 198 (ML for Business Decisions)
section_data.title: Co-founder and Instructor
details: Cofounded with one other student one of the most popular ML courses at Berkeley (200+ signups).
Responsibilities included content generation, lecturing, and facilitating

section_data.title: Project Leader and Project Developer
details: Veterans 360 – Ruby on Rails + React / React Native, web and mobile application allowing veterans to connect with other veterans and resources in their area. Lead a team of 4 individuals in building the application, reviewing pull requests and assigning sprint tasks.

Roots of Success - Developed using Ruby on Rails, React.js - created a dynamic and scalable web platform that allowed the NPO to upload course content and allowed their target demographic to take the uploaded course tracking progress and course completion. Implemented features include student and admin course dashboards, draggable components, interactive teaching slides, ability to add audio and more

section_data.title: Course Tutor and Reader
details: Lead office hours and graded homeworks & tests for the undergraduate and graduate combined machine learning course at U.C. Berkeley

Eagle Project: On My Feet (Web) – PHP/Vanilla JS/HTML, API’s including Google Maps, Google Directions etc. – included 1400 resources obtained through extensive DOM scraping (xPath, cURL) and crowd-sourcing – attracted over 400 weekly users at peek by 3 separate homeless organizations around the Bay Area. Gave several workshops on site functionality, teaching intake workers how to add, edit resource etc.

Worked with Professor Josh Hug to utilize Machine Learning libraries to intelligently analyze Congressional transcripts (SPCA), annotated and cleaned large CSV files with Pandas to make them more usable and to add relevant meta data to the files. Other tech includes Scipy, Numpy etc.
